traits(aliases).title: traits(aliases)
traits(aliases).desc: Returns all the `traits`. You can also pass an optional object defining aliases.

email.title: email
email.desc: Tries to return the `traits.email` and if it is not defined, it will check the `userId`  and return that if it is a valid email.

created.title: created
created.desc: Returns the `traits.created` and falls back on `traits.createdAt`.

companyCreated.title: companyCreated
companyCreated.desc: Returns `traits.company.created` and falls back on `traits.company.createdAt` and returns a `Date` object of it.

name.title: name
name.desc: Returns `traits.name` or optionally combines `traits.firstName` and `traits.lastName` if `traits.name` is not defined.

firstName.title: firstName
firstName.desc: Returns `traits.firstName`. If only `traits.name` is available, it will split it and give you the first name.

lastName.title: lastName
lastName.desc: Returns `traits.lastName`. If only `traits.name` is available, it will split it and give you the last name.

uid.title: uid
uid.desc: Returns the current userâ€™s `userId`, and falls back on `traits.username` then `traits.email`.

age.title: age
age.desc: Returns `traits.age` and if not will fall back on a calculated birthday based no `traits.birthday`.
